post.body: Don't know if it really counts as procrastination if you do other chores in its place. ;) Not lazy-procrastination, anyway.
I understand. Working on 2009 budget proposals for an upcoming meeting. Definitely not at the top of my Weekend Fun list.
Aww, that's what I was afraid of. :( Keanu, script, or both?
Thai food! A nice green curry and some tom yum soup, and a Thai iced tea... that's the way to go! :)
Yes, if I'd picked the cards they would have been the non-glittery variety. Looked like a 15 year old raver girl afterward.
Groovy, baby. We were going to put ours up this weekend, but it just didn't happen. Perhaps this week sometime... Merry Masmas! :)
:) I was thinking of making an accurate one, but it wouldn't be as visually appealing with the real distribution... hmm...
Also, I really dig the backlit keyboard on my (older) 15", and that's about the only other thing the 13" MacBook is missing.
I say last 15" MB Pro unless you don't care about Firewire and ExpressCard slot. If that's the case, new 13" MacBook is great.
I hate it when that happens.
Sounds like you need a do-over. I grant you a mulligan for the day!
:( I'm sorry. What's going on?*hug*
:( What's up? Would setting things on fire help?
This is pretty much what I'd expect it to resemble: http://www.hogranch.com/mayer/qtl.html
Yes, I suppose that works... so long as you don't get caught up in Laundry Theory, or the dryer is like a CS Lewis wardrobe.
That'd be one heck of a remote start! Get yourself a power inverter and then sew some seat covers made of electric blankets. :)
iPhone says low of 7, currently -15. What's up with that? I'm not complaining about 42 out here. :)
Off to bed, then up early for work. I think it's going to be a long week, but hopefully a productive one! G'night, internets.
Gabriel doesn't need a seat - he's perfectly content to sit on the table in place of mom's food: http://tinyurl.com/5642p5
Missing some data we need to finish closing things out, so we need to postpone. :-/ Bonus, though - free hot chocolate from a Starbucks run.
At work nice and early to support some year-end processes for our Finance folks... yay.
Point goes to Jon Stewart! http://tinyurl.com/5olerk
... and now my desk is covered in glitter. Ack!
Signing ~300 holiday cards for work. Ouch. Can't I just type my name?
Laying in bed, in the dark, listening to Gabriel having a dream through the baby monitor. Parenthood is wild, and awesome.
While we're on the subject, if you remember Right Said Fred: http://tinyurl.com/5v32jr
http://tinyurl.com/35rnkp Bugs me that it's not an accurate representation of their lyrical distribution, however.
3 parties in 3 days. Too much for me! And now too little time left to get other things done this weekend. Oh well, could be worse. :)
At Nicole's parent's place, prepping for ~50 person graduation party.
Perhaps TMI, but Nicole's breast pump is currently operating at the same frequency as the beat of the music we're listening to. Hi-larious.
... That's the first time he's obtained enjoyment from the taste of food. Ever, in his life. The faces he made were beyond adorable. XD
Ah, good ol' meatspace hacks. :) http://ow.ly/10X
Hey - Gabriel turned 5 months old today! Crazy. Now, off to bed...
Been at a post-convo get together for a while now. Gabriel is doing surprisingly well for being out /7 hours/. Passing him around the table.
Off to Nicole's mom's Nursing convocation!
... maybe time for a nap...
Finished with annual budget/planning meeting. Grim economic times. I started at 8AM yesterday, and I've worked 25 hours already this week.
Finally home! Have to be back at work in 4 hours. bleh.
